alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:29AM EDT until August 28 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... Southwestern Lenoir County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 1230 PM EDT. * At 929 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wallace, Warsaw, Kornegay, Rose Hill, Beulaville, Deep Run, Kenansville, Chinquapin, Potters Hill, Albertson, Sarecta, Magnolia, Greenevers, Pink Hill, Lyman and Teachey. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
